p.strong: Hit Points. Hit Dice: 1d10 per Knight level. Hit Points at 1st Level: 10 + your Constitution modifier. Hit Points at Higher Levels: 1d10 (or 6) + your Constitution modifier per Knight level after 1st.
Proficiencies. Armor: Light Armour, Medium Armour, Shields. Weapons: Simple Blasters, Simple and Martial Lightweapons, Simple and Martial Vibroweapons. Saving Throws: Wisdom and Charisma.
Skills. Choose 2 from Athletics, Intimidation, Persuasion, Insight, Performance.
Spell Save DC. 8 + Charisma modifier + Proficiency Bonus.
Focus. Focus is the resource you use to activate certain abilities. You always start with max Focus after any rest. You can regain Focus through the Meditation ability.

sheet.description: A Force-sensitive guardian wielding a lightsaber to protect the galaxy.

description.p: 1 Focus, Use the Force to push someone away. Each creature in a 15-foot line must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 2d8 kinetic damage and are pushed 10 feet away. On a successful save, the creature takes half damage and isn't pushed. Per extra Focus spent to a max of half your Knight level (rounded up), the ability deals an additional 1d8 kinetic damage and pushes 5 extra feet.

description.p: 1 Focus, You use the Force to manipulate a small or medium object, or a small creature, that you can see within range. You make an ability check using your Force ability, contested by the target’s Strength check. On a success, you may suspend and/or move up to 30 feet or throw the target. If you choose to suspend the target, it remains suspended for the duration. If you throw the target, make a ranged Force attack with a range of 30/60 feet. On a hit, the target you throw at takes kinetic damage based on what is thrown: Small object: 2d4 kinetic damage, Medium object: 2d6 kinetic damage, Small creature: 1d4 kinetic damage. If a creature is thrown, the thrown small creature takes 1d8 + your Force ability modifier kinetic damage.

description.p: 2 Focus, You wave your hand and speak a simple command to a creature you can see within range. The target makes a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature must follow the command on its next turn. On a successful save, the creature isn't tricked and if the creature isn't in combat, it will make an Arcana check against your Spell save DC to determine whether it knows you tried to mind trick it. This ability has no effect if the target is a Droid, does not understand your language, or is not intelligent enough. Per extra Focus spent to a max of half your Knight level (rounded up), you can target an additional creature.

description.p: A Knight's power comes from the light side of the Force. You have learned to draw on this power to cast spells.

Spellcasting Ability. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for your Knight spells, since the power of your magic relies on your ability to project your will into the world. You use your Charisma whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Charisma modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a Knight spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.
Spell Save DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier
Spell Attack Modifier = your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier

sheet.description: Charisma is your spellcasting ability for your Knight spells. Your spell save DC is 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier, and your spell attack modifier is your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier.
